title: Grade 11 - Mathematics for Work and Everyday Life MEL3E (2021)
subject: Mathematics

document.title: Grade 11 - Mathematics for Work and Everyday Life MEL3E (2021)

77C21218B6BE42D085DB1CA6496D6B37.description: solve problems involving the comparison of information concerning transportation by airplane, train, bus, and automobile in terms of various factors (e.g., cost, time, convenience)

5471C101CA8D4FCB854A1EFBCD39FAB3.description: gather, interpret, and describe information regarding routes, schedules, and fares for travel by airplane, train, or bus

39F2CD115EDB4FC98011B1E883638CCE.description: gather, interpret, and compare information about the costs (e.g., insurance, extra charges based on distance travelled) and conditions (e.g., one-way or return, drop-off time and location, age of the driver, required type of driver's licence) involved in renting a car, truck, or trailer, and use the information to justify a choice of rental vehicle

EC82BE2EA2F64E72BF587FA3A52BD750.description: gather, interpret, and describe information about the impact (e.g., monetary, health, environmental) of daily travel (e.g., to work and/or school), using available means (e.g., car, taxi, motorcycle, public transportation, bicycle, walking)

5396C0AE2485428D90B5190C1FB2041A.description: Comparing Modes of Transportation: interpret information about different modes of transportation, and solve related problems.

3EC56221E8B74361B16E0A6D8F56C5B1.description: solve problems involving the cost of travelling by automobile for personal or business purposes

B08D77D3D287424785B55D65A7DB6036.description: report, orally or in writing, on the estimated costs (e.g., gasoline, accommodation, food, entertainment, tolls, car rental) involved in a trip by automobile, using information from available sources (e.g., automobile association travel books, travel guides, the Internet)

A27F83E31C4A4D44BC028D70AB171C9C.description: plan and justify, orally or in writing, a route for a trip by automobile on the basis of a variety of factors (e.g., distances involved, the purpose of the trip, the time of year, the time of day, probable road conditions, personal priorities)

6EE2686D41C148F79D2AB398AD5B7C53.description: determine distances represented on maps (e.g., provincial road map, local street map, Web-based maps), using given scales

E49C7EEC88794378A9F6C6BBAACB872F.description: Travelling by Automobile: plan and justify a route for a trip by automobile, and solve problems involving the associated costs;

B02C3A11AFDF4C189D4B789255591C90.description: solve problems, using technology (e.g., calculator, spreadsheet), that involve the fixed costs (e.g., licence fee, insurance) and variable costs (e.g., maintenance, fuel) of owning and operating a vehicle

EFA811279E404414909E507EA1E51E5B.description: identify and describe costs (e.g., gas consumption, depreciation, insurance, maintenance) and benefits (e.g., convenience, increased profit) of owning and operating a vehicle for business

4246D159C5FC49B792316BA3CD127976.description: describe ways of failing to operate a vehicle responsibly (e.g., lack of maintenance, careless driving) and possible financial and non-financial consequences (e.g., legal costs, fines, higher insurance rates, demerit points, loss of driving privileges)

609A1793E83F4C948BCBC4A6BEC7B6E6.description: gather and interpret information about the costs (e.g., monthly payments, insurance, depreciation, maintenance, miscellaneous expenses) of purchasing or leasing a new vehicle or purchasing a used vehicle, and describe the conditions that favour each alternative

7BA559C2244240099B07E3D03A05E850.description: gather and interpret information about the procedures and costs involved in insuring a vehicle (e.g., car, motorcycle, snowmobile) and the factors affecting insurance rates (e.g., gender, age, driving record, model of vehicle, use of vehicle), and compare the insurance costs for different categories of drivers and for different vehicles

101F00EE84C647DABA8B63A4FC7D0254.description: gather and describe information about the procedures involved in buying or leasing a new vehicle or buying a used vehicle

B422BCA2F03047ED9B927D8E3891C38C.description: gather and interpret information about the procedures (e.g., in the graduated licensing system) and costs (e.g., driver training; licensing fees) involved in obtaining an Ontario driver's licence, and the privileges and restrictions associated with having a driver's licence

93CED6A9CF824355A2151DC1544E87F2.description: Owning and Operating a Vehicle: interpret information about owning and operating a vehicle, and solve problems involving the associated costs;

443D2427A1C04CA49473270B36B3D849.description: make and justify a decision to borrow, using various criteria (e.g., income, cost of borrowing, availability of an item, need for an item) under various circumstances (e.g., having a large existing debt, wanting to pursue an education or training opportunity, needing transportation to a new job, wanting to set up a business)

3F673742D6A648E09B69E392D8F59C5F.description: gather and interpret information about credit ratings, and describe the factors used to determine credit ratings and the consequences of a good or bad rating

B37CBAF384364D8B8862D96C3EF40650.description: compare, using a variety of tools (e.g., spreadsheet template, online amortization tables), the effects of various payment periods (e.g., monthly, biweekly) on the length of time taken to repay a loan and on the total interest paid

EE0B8970888B4A478DFE455B5E6DDB40.description: determine, using a variety of tools (e.g., spreadsheet template, online amortization tables), the effect of the length of time taken to repay a loan on the principal and interest components of a personal loan repayment

3E49D4B749754994884C0609AD3E25EE.description: calculate, using technology (e.g., calculator, spreadsheet), the total interest paid over the life of a personal loan, given the principal, the length of the loan, and the periodic payments, and use the calculations to justify the choice of a personal loan

D3FCA9338B6740889186A5FAF64CD5E3.description: gather, interpret, and compare information describing the features (e.g., interest rates, flexibility) and conditions (e.g., eligibility, required collateral) of various personal loans (e.g., student loan, car loan, "no interest" deferred-payment loan, loan to consolidate debt, loan drawn on a line of credit, payday or bridging loan)

C05C66666AD94AF0813D0569F8F6AB07.description: gather, interpret, and compare information about the effects of carrying an outstanding balance on a credit card at current interest rates

244B25CD1F32400B997D6BBEF6454B28.description: Borrowing: . interpret information about different ways of borrowing and their associated costs, and make and justify informed borrowing decisions.

65045BCDB2944DDBBDF0181E8BA4AD28.description: solve problems, using technology, that involve applications of compound interest to saving and investing

BE00133C98CB4CC68651A3E8521427CB.description: determine, through investigation using technology (e.g., a TVM Solver on a graphing calculator or on a website), the effect on the future value of a compound interest investment of changing the total length of time, the interest rate, or the compounding period

746533DCB4EB4516B856065C892B8160.description: describe the relationship between simple interest and compound interest in various ways (i.e., orally, in writing, using tables and graphs)

9C2819CB388941F3B949C00E247F1866.description: determine, through investigation using technology, the compound interest for a given investment, using repeated calculations of simple interest for no more than 6 compounding periods

0A0DFD18ABB44DA1B3E1C09FCA8FB834.description: determine, through investigation using technology (e.g., calculator, spreadsheet), the effect on simple interest of changes in the principal, interest rate, or time, and solve problems involving applications of simple interest

95614EA668EF4BC8A753A2135C14BCAA.description: Saving and Investing: demonstrate an understanding of simple and compound interest, and solve problems involving related applications;

A3706DABA3EA42EF9632CBD7B047B7E4.description: read and interpret transaction codes and entries from various financial statements (e.g., bank statement, credit card statement, passbook, automated banking machine printout, online banking statement, account activity report), and explain ways of using the information to manage personal finances

25AD22CDCAEA49BE8A4A9D9C80738881.description: gather, interpret, and compare information about the costs (e.g., user fees, annual fees, service charges, interest charges on overdue balances) and incentives (e.g., loyalty rewards; philanthropic incentives, such as support for Olympic athletes or a Red Cross disaster relief fund) associated with various credit cards and debit cards

51EFCE7C013D4940AEF0A85F00CDB2DA.description: gather, interpret, and compare information about the various savings alternatives commonly available from financial institutions (e.g., savings and chequing accounts, term investments), the related costs (e.g., cost of cheques, monthly statement fees, early withdrawal penalties), and possible ways of reducing the costs (e.g., maintaining a minimum balance in a savings account; paying a monthly flat fee for a package of services)

69BC2EC9930743E98BABCAB4D86CB6D9.description: Comparing Financial Services: describe and compare services available from financial institutions;

13F3885C63EF4B67A4E7D6FFD947442E.description: make and justify a decision regarding the purchase of an item, using various criteria (e.g., extra costs, such as shipping costs and transaction fees; quality and quantity of the item; shelf life of the item; method of purchase, such as online versus local) under various circumstances (e.g., not having access to a vehicle; living in a remote community; having limited storage space)

9AE9E8F007EE4462856F1C29A4B273E1.description: describe and compare, for different types of transactions, the extra costs that may be associated with making purchases (e.g., interest costs, exchange rates, shipping and handling costs, customs duty, insurance)

F4842CF4F066454C991AD33902917B3D.description: compare the unit prices of related items to help determine the best buy

1D1313244A06453DB715AD64108F79C8.description: make the correct change from an amount offered to pay a charge, using currency manipulatives

EC97874185CE45BB999C73F63B59E330.description: estimate the change from an amount offered to pay a charge

5B9DC682E1DC455AA6E102F9C9DEA9CE.description: identify forms of taxation built into the cost of an item or service (e.g., gasoline tax, tire tax)

925816B965E34D048300BAB26504363A.description: calculate discounts, sale prices, and after-tax costs, using technology

E8D67F8633FD4377B7CF2A25BB02325E.description: describe and compare a variety of strategies for estimating sales tax (e.g., estimate the sales tax on most purchases in Ontario by estimating 10% of the purchase price and adding about a third of this estimate, rather than estimating the PST and GST separately), and use a chosen strategy to estimate the after-tax cost of common items

A8B85FF842C4457EAC811CB9E99431F1.description: estimate the sale price before taxes when making a purchase (e.g., estimate 25% off 1/4 of $38.99 as 25% or off of $40, giving a discount of about $10 and a sale price of approximately $30; alternatively, estimate the same sale price as about 3/4 of $40)

DCEE2434337A4E2CAEB64F57E96B8686.description: identify and describe various incentives in making purchasing decisions (e.g., 20% off; 1/3 off; buy 3 get 1 free; loyalty rewards; coupons; 0% financing)

5A14DAD23C084259A7F599D5E64FEA59.description: Purchasing: demonstrate an understanding of the factors and methods involved in making and justifying informed purchasing decisions

8F17E772E9FA4F4197735D1C05365826.description: describe and compare the purchasing power and living standards associated with relevant occupations of interest

F5C3B5C3F369421893334C50BDAF22CE.description: describe the relationship between gross pay, net pay, and payroll deductions (i.e., net pay is gross pay less government payroll deductions and any other payroll deductions), and estimate net pay in various situations

0442DBAD41E845FFA2F89B05B9EFE2E4.description: estimate and compare, using current secondary data (e.g., federal tax tables), the percent of total earnings deducted through government payroll deductions for various benchmarks (e.g., $15 000, $20 000, $25 000)

7142CD758A1D40DF829783BDA9605862.description: gather, interpret, and describe information about government payroll deductions (i.e., CPP, EI, income tax) and other payroll deductions (e.g., contributions to pension plans other than CPP; union dues; charitable donations; benefit-plan contributions)

78D3CBF38AA64E17AB718D61F9A980F0.description: Describing Purchasing Power: demonstrate an understanding of payroll deductions and their impact on purchasing power;

14979FA81D3647438555C2EB85095D0D.description: solve problems, using technology (e.g., calculator, spreadsheet), and make decisions involving different remuneration methods and schedules

408D15C762834492BDB11F04C06F4E2B.description: describe the effects of different remuneration methods and schedules on decisions related to personal spending habits (e.g., the timing of a major purchase, the scheduling of mortgage payments and other bill payments)

2C6617936D78403897CAA8022C953AD5.description: gather, interpret, and describe information about different remuneration methods (e.g., hourly rate, overtime rate, job or project rate, commission, salary, gratuities) and remuneration schedules (e.g., weekly, biweekly, semimonthly, monthly)

DC2038BFC7944CFBBE7E2800FE77ED4A.description: gather, interpret, and compare information about the components of total earnings (e.g., salary, benefits, vacation pay, profit-sharing) in different occupations

9C14A5B37410421985B321BDFB0049C7.description: Earning: . interpret information about different types of remuneration, and solve problems and make decisions involving different remuneration methods;
